result.execSummary:
The defendant Lindsay K Alvarez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Defendant to contact DOC by 09:00 a.m. on 09-03-2015.
Items seized are forfeited and can be destroyed by the holding Agency pursuant to statute.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Lindsay K Alvarez in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Counts 2 - 4 are dismissed as read ins.



Court orders the following:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.

Term of Probation:  18 Months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
DNA Sample.
Defendant to contact DOC by 9:00 am. tomorrow morning (09/03/15).

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Court Orders - Items seized are forfeited and can be destroyed by the holding agency pursuant to statute.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.   

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 2, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Konrad Paczuski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Lindsay K Alvarez in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   
File not called on the record.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Lindsay K Alvarez in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 19, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Lindsay K Alvarez in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Lindsay K Alvarez in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 10:00 am.
